publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-1447 Hugh Henry: Renfrewshire Recycling—That the Parliament notes the valuable contribution made by Renfrewshire Recycling to environmental improvement, helping poorer families and assisting the unemployed into work; notes that Renfrewshire Council commended the project for its work and that the council spent over £20 million last year on recycling initiatives; further notes that £500,000 per year would keep the project alive, and calls on the Scottish Executive and Renfrewshire Council to provide funds to enable the Wise Group to sustain this valuable project.
S3M-1447 Renfrewshire Recycling (lodged on 27 February 2008) Marilyn Livingstone*, Patrick Harvie*, Sarah Boyack*, Cathy Peattie*, Elaine Smith*, Karen Gillon*

S3M-1447 Hugh Henry: Renfrewshire Recycling—That the Parliament notes the valuable contribution made by Renfrewshire Recycling to environmental improvement, helping poorer families and assisting the unemployed into work; notes that Renfrewshire Council commended the project for its work and that the council spent over £20 million last year on recycling initiatives; further notes that £500,000 per year would keep the project alive, and calls on the Scottish Executive and Renfrewshire Council to provide funds to enable the Wise Group to sustain this valuable project. Supported by: Marilyn Livingstone, Patrick Harvie, Sarah Boyack, Cathy Peattie, Elaine Smith, Karen Gillon, Mary Mulligan*, Jackie Baillie*, Helen Eadie*, John Park*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-1447 Renfrewshire Recycling (lodged on 27 February 2008) Ms Wendy Alexander*
S3M-1447 Renfrewshire Recycling (lodged on 27 February 2008) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-1447 Renfrewshire Recycling (lodged on 27 February 2008) Trish Godman*
S3M-1447 Renfrewshire Recycling (lodged on 27 February 2008) Johann Lamont*, Ken Macintosh*
